common.name: Name
common.form_invalid_alert: Please address the errors in your form to proceed
common.input_filed_invalid_helper_text: Must start with a letter and end with a letter or number. Valid characters include lowercase letters from a to z, numbers from 0 to 9, and hyphens ( - ).
common.quick_start_guide_message: Need help getting started? Follow our quick start guide.
common.input_text_area_invalid_helper_text: Valid characters include letters from Aa to Zz, numbers from 0 to 9, spaces, and line breaks.
common.delete_service_registry_description: The {{name}} Service Registry instance and all artifacts will be deleted. Applications will no longer have access to the artifacts in this instance.
common.delete_service_registry_download_zip: To save your data for future use, we recommend downloading a zip file of all the artifacts.
common.adjust_your_filters_and_try_again: Adjust your filters and try again.
common.no_permission_to_connect_registry: Ask the Service Registry instance owner for connection information.
common.no_permission_to_delete_service_registry: Organization administrators and the Service Registry instance owner can delete this instance.

srs.empty_state_registry_description: To get started, create a Service Registry instance.
srs.unauthorized_empty_state_body: To set up a Service Registry, your account needs the appropriate access entitlements
srs.tab_sample_code_title_info: Below are example configuration snippets for accessing Service Registry from different runtimes.
srs.connection_title_info: Use this information to connect an application or tool to this Service Registry.
srs.registry_success_message: The creation of the {{name}} Service Registry instance is ready for you.
srs.registry_failed_message: The creation of the {{name}} Service Registry instance is failed
